description: Certificate of Lawfulness for change of use from Use class C3(a)(Residential Dwelling) to Use Class C3(b) for three residents (Aged 7 and above) living together as a single household where care is provided involving conversion of integral garage to habitable use to include alterations to front fenestration
decision_conditions: The proposed use of the application site would be within the provisions of  the Class C3b of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) and no material change of use would have taken place from the current lawful use within Class C3(a) of that Order.

The proposed garage conversion would come within the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, thereby not requiring planning permission.

This certificate provides confirmation that the development is lawful.  You should also check whether the proposed garage conversion requires separate Building Regulation consent. Information is available on the Building Control webpages via http://www.havering.gov.uk/Pages/Category/Building-control.aspx?l1=200252 and the team is available between 9am and 10am Monday to Friday via 01708 432700.
Development is permitted by Class A subject to the following conditions-
(a) the materials used in any exterior work (other than materials used in the
construction of a conservatory) shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse;
(b) any upper-floor window located in a wall or roof slope forming a side elevation of the dwellinghouse shall be-
(ii) non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more
than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed; and

(c) where the enlarged part of the dwellinghouse has more than one storey, the roof pitch of the enlarged part shall, so far as practicable, be the same as the roof pitch of the original dwellinghouse.
